docs.snippet: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 17. -- Postmaster George A. Hurd of Haworth was placed on trial here before Judge William M. Seufert today on charges preferred by Miss Martha L. Conrad, who says she is 16 years old. She was his assistant in the Post Office....
docs.lead_paragraph: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 17. -- Postmaster George A. Hurd of Haworth was placed on trial here before Judge William M. Seufert today on charges preferred by Miss Martha L. Conrad, who says she is 16 years old. She was his assistant in the Post Office. Miss Conrad's former home was at 281 West 177th Street, New York.
docs.abstract: Miss Conrad tells of trips with him, defendant in denial charges political plot

headline.main: MISS CONRAD TELLS OF TRIPS WITH HURD; Testifies She Went to Atlantic City Convention with Postmaster of Haworth, N. J. NEW YORK VISITS ALLEGED She Says They Stopped Together at Hotels, but Defendant, in Denial, Charges a Political Plot.

docs.snippet: According to a report of Consul General James A. Smith, who is stationed at Calcutta, the total area under cotton in India for the 1914-1915 season is 24,632,000 acres, or nearly 2 per cent. less than the revised figures showed last year. The total...
docs.lead_paragraph: According to a report of Consul General James A. Smith, who is stationed at Calcutta, the total area under cotton in India for the 1914-1915 season is 24,632,000 acres, or nearly 2 per cent. less than the revised figures showed last year. The total estimated yield, he says, is 5,232,000 bales of 400 pounds each, or 3 per cent. more than in 1913-1914.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 25. -- Important developments in two directions marked the second day of the Pan-American Financial Conference here. The importance of establishing a fast and frequent shipping service between the United States and southern ports was...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 25. -- Important developments in two directions marked the second day of the Pan-American Financial Conference here. The importance of establishing a fast and frequent shipping service between the United States and southern ports was indicated by Secretary. McAdoo of the Treasury when he announced the appointment of an extraordinary committee to consider the subject.
docs.abstract: appoints extraordinary committee at Pan-Amer. Financial Conference to consider problem of shipping service

docs.snippet: RIO JANEIRO, June 3. -- Dr. Lauro Muller, Foreign Minister of Brazil, made a triumphal return yesterday from his tour of Uruguay, Argentina, and Chile, undertaken to strengthen the bond of the South American republics. He was met at the railroad...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO JANEIRO, June 3. -- Dr. Lauro Muller, Foreign Minister of Brazil, made a triumphal return yesterday from his tour of Uruguay, Argentina, and Chile, undertaken to strengthen the bond of the South American republics. He was met at the railroad station by representatives of the American diplomatic corps, high Government officials, and leading civilians.
docs.abstract: Dr. Muller acclaimed on return to Brazil

docs.lead_paragraph: Notice was filed at White Plains yesterday of the discontinuance of the action brought by the Duchess of Durazzo, who was Miss Elizabeth Frances Hanan, sister of John H. Hanan, the shoe manufacturer, to annul her marriage to Duke Arturo di Majo Durazzo of Italy.

headline.main: DURAZZO WEDDING NOT TO BE VOIDED; Duchess Discontinues the Action She Began to Annul Her Marriage to Italian Duke. HE MIGHT SEEK PROPERTY Lawyers, Refusing to Give Reasons, Say There Has Been No Reconciliation and No Settlement.

docs.snippet: Your editorial on "The State Sinking Fund" in the issue of May 25 is a very clear and helpful commentary on some of the gravest problems that confront the Constitutional Convention. Indeed, one may say without contradiction that the Committee on...
docs.lead_paragraph: Your editorial on "The State Sinking Fund" in the issue of May 25 is a very clear and helpful commentary on some of the gravest problems that confront the Constitutional Convention. Indeed, one may say without contradiction that the Committee on State Finance, of which Mr. Henry L. Stimson is Chairman, has in its hands the most important problems to be met by revision of our fundamental law.

headline.main: STATE SINKING FUND SUBJECT OF DEBATE; Lawrence Chamberlain Tells of the Cheapness of Serial Debt Retirement.
